storyInfo: Casualties in the city are heavy. The flames of hatred burn furiously. Loughshinny returns to the city with Brigid. In the ruins, the wakemen and Moran talk about Tara's past. In the tavern, the unnamed woman continues the story.

attributes.content: This is far enough. We're already at the wakemen camp.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Your sister roused me from my slumber. You could always return me to it with your own flames, if you want.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: Reed!
A golden-haired Perro leaps off the back of a burdenbeast and rushes toward the red dragon.
The burdenbeast is dragging an improvised cart with numerous long wooden boxes stacked upon it.
—Brigid?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: What are you doing here? Are those—
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: ...Coffins?!
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Yeah, coffins. Nemos said to bring 'em to the wakemen. Are they still in the ruins?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Say, is there someone with you? I can smell that same burning stink, and I could swear I heard you talking just now—
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: The Exiled King

attributes.content: No, I'm alone.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: These are...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Dead folks.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: The type who'd pull their own arms out of their sockets to bite at their imaginary enemies if you grabbed their hand. Along with the poor wretches they tore to pieces.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: And Theo. Nemos found him in the end. He...
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: It's almost like this was the natural order of things. The bonfires will be burnin' brightest when night falls on Samhain...
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: The red dragon looks towards Na Saoirsí, and sees a faint shadow in the distance, painting the silhouette of purple flames.
We'll be out of coffins if this keeps up.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: I hope Brigid made it out of the city. And that the mist in the woods is thin enough for her to follow the trail...
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Blast it, Culann left a few unused weapons in his house. I can't let anyone see them.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: And this fuel... explosives? Her Highness Loughshinny might find a use for them.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: No, what's the point when every servant in the citadel has already been afflicted by the purple flames? Besides, the greedy red dragon has already sent them away.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Almost as if... she's preparing for a showdown with Her Highness.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Or... setting a trap?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Who's there?!
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Rory? What are you doing here?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: You're... Nemos.
attributes.name: Brooding Resident

attributes.content: Yes, I'm going through Culann's effects. If this isn't urgent, could I ask you to—
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Traitor.
attributes.name: Brooding Resident

attributes.content: Have you gone mad?!
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Oh, silly me. Of course you have. We all have.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Traitor—
attributes.name: Brooding Resident

attributes.content: I... I still can't bring myself to kill them. Even if they might as well be dead already.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Ha. Hahahah...
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: I'd better drag this fellow back home. Could do without the unwanted attention.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Phew...
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Nemos?
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: D-Don't mind me, I'll be on my way.
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: What's that in your hand?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Oh, nothing. Now, if you'll excuse me—
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: That necklace. It was a gift from Niels to Emma.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: I-I gave her bread! That's way more valuable than jewelry in times like these! She gave it to me!
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: Did she now? A necklace she never takes off?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: I-It's none of your business!
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: Nemos? You stayed behind? I thought all the Dublinners left the city!
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: Don't tell me you're one of those living statues now, who refuse to move or talk?
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: I might be soon. Why did you bring them up?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Samhain begins tonight. So I went through the houses of the missing people, and found plenty of good stuff for the party tonight!
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: ...Samhain? Party?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: About Culann—well, he was already on his last legs by then, and I didn't really...
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: Let's not talk about that! Look at all this stuff! It'll be a night to remember!
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: The woman shows Nemos her bag, revealing a bottle of curded cystymilk, a few long-since-sprouted potatoes, and several bare bones.
Just wait for me, Nemos, Culann... we'll have a fantastic Samhain...
attributes.name: Friendly Resident

attributes.content: Only when the woman has already disappeared around a corner does Nemos remember who she is: a villager who once lived on the outskirts of Na Saoirsí.
Two years ago, the Victorians took her father away while investigating Dublinn. The autumn harvest had just ended, and she had been preparing to celebrate the harvest festival.
What Loughshinny hears about the situation in the city exceeds her wildest imagination.
I must go back. Now.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Wait for me. I'll come with once I've delivered these folks to the wakemen.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Are you sure about this, Brigid?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: It's dangerous in the city. If I fail... there may be no survivors.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: True, but I still gotta go.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Because it wasn't like this before.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: The cityfolk never had much to spare, but they always had a cup of water for me when I delivered their letters.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: They didn't see me as one of their own, but didn't walk away with a sneer when I told them nomad legends either. They listened.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: And they definitely didn't bite, claw, and punch at people like they do these days. Like the walking dead straight from a story.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Who will the nomads deliver letters for, if the city dies for real?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Moran?
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: The second shipment of bodies has arrived from Na Saoirsí. I must make the preparations.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: At this rate, it won't be long until the third, fourth, or more.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Are we really going to ignore it?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: As I've told you many times, the wakemen do not take sides. It is not our decision to make.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: Are the Na Saoirsíans not Tarans too? Why are we standing on the side watching, when the Taran capital is marching towards destruction?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: I know you came back with the red dragon. You fear she will meet the same fate as Labhréathach.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: But we were the ones to send Labhréathach to his doom.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: We are descended from the priests that once officiated the ceremonies of Tara's royal palace.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: Our ancestors, moved by Labhréathach's plea, welcomed him back into the palace when Ailill's stance was ambivalent.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: The flames of death that spread through the plains of Tara were only extinguished seven days after his death, when our ancestors finally returned his fire to him.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: They then left the palace of their own accord, going into self-exile on Labhréathach's former pastures, so as to never forget the lesson. And thus, the wakemen were born.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: ...I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: But Reed isn't Labhréathach, and history is not a cycle that repeats itself endlessly.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: If it were, Reed would have already died in that citadel.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Even her tyrant of a sister was the one to free Tara from Victorian rule.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Fates are often alike, but always differ where it matters most.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: 'Fates are often alike, but always differ where it matters most.'
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: What a wonderful tagline for the cover of the book. Surely this one is destined for the best-seller charts.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: Assuming, of course, that you are ever able to finish the story.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: I've never intended to profit off it.
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: Oh, you will. If not in money, then in fame.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: The basis of the story, where it happened... There are more than enough reasons this isn't my story to tell.
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: Besides, what happens next?
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: That's what I wanted to ask. Did Loughshinny go back?
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: From this point on, what I've seen, what I believe, and what I've said all contradict one another. Which is why I've lost sight of the ending.
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: Feel free to take up the challenge, if you're up to it. Give this dance between the dragon and her reflection whatever ending you please.
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: Oh? Is it all the same if I tell it myself?
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: Of course, ma'am. As you will it—
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: The writer raises his mug, which is almost empty now, and toasts the woman before him.
Once again, he swallows the bitter brew, half-expecting the sweet aftertaste that he knows will never come.
Did I spook you? You got so polite all of a sudden. It makes me feel impertinent for even pressing the question.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: No. But I must make it abundantly clear that everything we have discussed until now is no more than idle chatter. You understand, don't you?
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: The woman sits straight and does not say a word. The writer can only attempt to guess whether she is still smiling through the shadows.
Well? What are you waiting for? I've nearly finished my drink.
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: I've fallen into the same conundrum as you.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: If this is as far as both your references and your imagination go, how could I possibly put the red dragon's ultimate fate to paper?
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: I've already said all I'm able to. I refuse to give this story an entirely fictional end, one that not even I could believe in. Even if the alternative is that there is no ending.
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: If you don't have an answer either, then no need to waste your time here. Leave while it's still early.
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: Is this because you do not remember, do not understand, or is it because you wish you never knew, never understood?
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: —What?
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: What are you getting at?
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: You've never 'lost sight of the ending.' It would be more appropriate to say that your eyes have become clouded by too many 'creative liberties'. Shall I recount them for you?
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: Treasures leading people into the darkness.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: Culann dragging the statue to the square by himself.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: And virtually everything related to the dark mist in the woods: from the rejection of Brigid, to the food carts returning to the city on their own, to Loughshinny becoming lost in the woods, to The Brigadier and Eblana's meeting in the city.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: If these 'creative liberties' have created the contradictions in your mind, then it is my responsibility to set them on a path towards the ending.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: Shall I supplement the story with my own observations?
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: I'll take that as a yes.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: Perhaps they will lead you to a conclusion you can be satisfied with.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman
